metadata.title: CVE-2019-3466 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The pg_ctlcluster script in postgresql-common in versions prior to 210didn't drop privileges when creating socket/statistics temporarydirectories, which could result in local privilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql - 9.5+173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-client - 9.5+173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-contrib - 9.5+173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-client-common - 173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-common - 173ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-common package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '173ubuntu0.3').
postgresql-common package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '173ubuntu0.3').
